Using Snell's law, n2 = sqrt(2) sin r.
Angle of incidence at the second surface is 60° for light to exit perpendicular to AC.
Using Snell's law for the second surface: n2 sin 60° = n3 sin 90°.
Refractive index n3 is consistent with light exiting at 90°.
Distance AO is half the length of AB, so AO = L/2.
Calculate distance d1 using geometry and angle of incidence.
Light reflects off hypotenuse and travels distance d2 before exiting.
Total distance traveled by light in prism is sum of d1 and d2.
Propagation speed of light in prism is v = C/n.
Total time t is given by t = d/v = dn/C.
